Definitions.Paraphrase:
a part of something that is used for holding or opening it
柄，把手
She turned the handle and opened the door. 
她转了一下把手，开了门。

deal with or control
处理，处置，操纵
This port handles 100 million tons of goods each year. 
这港口每年要处理1亿吨货物。
I have a problem at work and I really don't know how to handle it. 
我工作上遇到了一个问题，真不知如何来处理它。

a small rounded piece of metal with a pointed end that is fired from a gun
枪弹，子弹
The bullet hit her in the arm. 
子弹射中了她的手臂。

advise or say that you support a particular plan or action  
主张，拥护，提倡
The minister advocated a change of the tax laws. 
这位部长主张修改税收法。

a person who supports a particular plan or action, especially in public  
拥护者，提倡者
She has always been an advocate of changes to English spelling, to make it easier to learn. 
她一贯主张对英语的拼写进行改革，使之更易于学习。

strange; unusual; peculiar  
奇怪的；奇特的
There is something odd about him. 
他有点怪怪的。
It's a bit odd that she didn't phone to say she couldn't come.  
有点奇怪的是她没有打电话来说她不能来了。

lack of information or knowledge 
无知，不知
The mistake was due to ignorance. 
这错误是由于无知造成的。
The workers were in complete ignorance of the managers' plans. 
工人们对管理部门的计划一无所知。

wrong moral behavior in general; something which is against the law  
罪，罪行
There has been an increase in car crime recently. 
最近汽车犯罪一直呈上升趋势。

1. collected information shown in numbers  
统计资料；统计
Statistics show that 90 per cent of homes in this country have a television. 
统计资料表明这国家百分之九十的家庭拥有电视机。
2. (with singular v.) the science of collecting and examining these numbers for patterns  
统计学

coming or happening before or earlier
以前的，先前的
Do you have previous experience of this type of work? 
你以前有过从事这类工作的经历吗？
She has two children from her previous marriage.
她身边有两个与前夫生的孩子。

before the present time  
以前，先前（地）
Before I moved to France I had previously worked in Italy and Spain. 
我移居法国前，曾在意大利和西班牙工作过。

great roughness and force, that destroys, injures or damages 
暴力（行为），强暴（行为），猛烈
Try not to use violence against children. 
尽量不要对儿童实施暴力行为。
She was frightened by the violence of the storm. 
她被风暴的猛烈吓坏了。

having, using, or showing great force  
暴力的，强暴的，猛烈的
The revolution started peacefully but later turned violent. 
这场革命开始时很平静，但后来变得十分猛烈。
There was a violent storm at sea.
海上有猛烈的风暴。
He has a violent nature. 
他性情很暴躁。

1. influence or cause someone or something to change in a particular way 
影响
Her personal problems seem to be affecting her work. 
她个人方面的问题似乎正影响着她的工作。
Loud music can affect your hearing.  
喧噪的音乐会影响你的听力。
2. cause someone to feel very sad, angry, etc.
（在感情方面）打动，震动
The whole community was affected by the terrible event.
这可怕的事件使整个社区大受震动。

move someone or something from one place to another (in a vehicle)  
运送，搬运
The goods were transported by air. 
这些货物是空运的。

a person's home; the grand house of someone important 
住处，住宅，大宅

1. having the ability of or quality for doing something
能...... 的，有...... 能力的
You are capable of better work than this. 
你能干得比这好。
I'm sure he is capable of running a mile in four minutes. 
我肯定他有能力在四分钟内跑一英里。
2. having (especially practical) ability; able 
有能力的；有才能的
a very capable woman  
一位非常能干的妇女

1. plan, mean or make something for a particular person or purpose 
（为......而）准备，打算使...... (成为)
You shouldn't have read that letter; it wasn't intended for you.  
你不该读那封信，那信不是写给你的。
This dictionary is intended for international learners of English.  
这本词典是专为学习英语的外国学生编的。
2. plan or mean to do something 
想要，打算，计划
I'm afraid I spent more money than I had intended. 
我想我花的钱已超过我原来计划的了。
I intended to telephone but I completely forgot. 
我原打算打电话的，可忘得个一干二净。

harm or hurt a person, animal or part of the body  
伤害，损害（健康等）
David was badly injured in the accident. 
戴维在事故中伤得很重。

1. face or meet an enemy, difficulty, etc.  
与 ......相对，面临，遭遇
She knew she'd have to confront her parents when she got home.  
她知道回家时必须面对自己的父母。
We try to help people confront their problems. 
我们试图帮助人们去面对自己的问题。
2. make someone face or consider someone or something unpleasant, difficult, etc. 
使面对，使面临，使当面作证
When the teacher confronted Tommy with the facts, he admitted it. 
当这位教师把证据摆在汤米面前时，他坦白了。

something only existing or happening in your mind, not in physical life
想象力, 想象的事物
Children often have active imagination.
孩子们常常有丰富的想象力。
Did you hear that noise, or was it my imagination? 
你听到那声音了没有？还是仅仅是我的想象？

that which is actual or physical and not imagined
现实，实际
We had hoped that things would get easy but the reality was very different. 
我曾希望事情会变得容易些，可现实却截然不同。

1. a room  
房间
2. a flat; a set of rooms for living in  
一套公寓房间

what someone intends or means to do; a plan or purpose  
意图，打算，目的
It was still not clear what his intentions were when he left the university. 
到他离开大学时还不清楚他究竟是什么动机。
Our intention was to leave early in the morning.  
我们打算早上早点走。
I've got no intention of staying indoors on a nice sunny day like this.
像这样一个阳光明媚的日子，我根本不打算待在屋里。

on purpose; not by chance  
故意地，有意地
I can't believe the boys broke the windows intentionally. 
我相信这些男孩不是故意打碎窗玻璃的。

not include something  
排除，省略
You can omit the last two sentences of the passage. 
你可以把这篇文章的最后两句话删去。

have control over (a place or a person), or be the most important person or thing 
支配，统治，在......中占首要地位
He refuses to let others speak and dominates every meeting.  
他不想让别人说话，所以他控制着每次会议。
The tree, which had grown too large, dominated the little garden. 
这棵树长得太大了，独占了这小庭园。

a woman or a girl; an animal that can produce babies from its own body 
女性（的）; 雌性动物
You don't see many females alone walking around that area after dark. 
天黑之后，女士很少单独在这地区四周走动。
She devoted her whole life to the cause of female rights to be equal. 
她把一生都奉献给了争取女性平等的事业。

(offensive) a person belonging to, or born from, the black-skinned races of Africa 
（含歧视意味）黑人，具有黑人血统的人

a man or a boy; an animal that cannot have babies  
男性（的）; 雄性动物
As a simple male, I wouldn't dare comment on that.  
作为一个普通男人，我不敢对那件事妄加评论。
About 60 per cent of the students are male in this university.  
在这所大学，大约百分之六十的学生是男性。

1. the liquid that is used as fuel for motor vehicles such as cars and airplanes  
汽油
gas station  
加油站
2. a form of matter that is like air 
气，气体
Hydrogen and oxygen are gases. 
氢和氧是气体。

the person in a bank, shop, gas station, etc. that customers pay money to or get money from  
出纳员，收银员

make something known; show; allow to be seen  
揭示，展现，使显露
All their secrets have been revealed. 
他们所有的秘密都被泄露了。
The curtains opened to reveal an empty stage.  
幕布拉开，展现出了一个空荡荡的舞台。
He revealed that he had been in prison twice before. 
他透露他以前进过两次监狱。

a feeling of worry or fear  
焦虑，担忧
There are anxieties over the effects of job losses. 
人们对失业的影响感到忧心忡忡。

a particular part of a town and the people who live there 
地段，地区，居民点
We've just moved into the neighborhood and don't know our way around yet. 
我们刚搬到这个地方，还不熟悉周围的情况。

(the situation when) something that might happen or be true; something that is possible; the state of being possible 
可能（性），可能的事，可能的情况
What's the possibility of the weather getting better before the weekend? 
在周末前天气变好有多大可能性？
Is there any possibility that I can see you this weekend? 
这周末我有可能见到你吗？

cause danger to
使遭受危险
You will endanger your health if you smoke too much. 
如果抽烟太多，会危害你的健康。

a car  
汽车
the automobile industry  
汽车制造业

1. (used about a machine) that can work by itself without direct human control  
自动的，以自动装置完成的
an automatic washing machine  
一台自动洗衣机
2. (used about actions) done without thinking or like a machine  
不经思索的，机械的
She knew the lesson so well that her answers were   automatic 
她对这一课极为熟悉，能够不经思索随口回答问题。

1. without thinking about what you are doing
不加思索地，无意识地
"Of course," I replied automatically.  
"当然啰。"我不加思索地答道。
2. by the action of a machine, without a person making it work  
自动地
The light will come on automatically when it gets dark.
天一黑，灯就会自动亮起来。

1. having broken a law; being responsible for doing something wrong  
有罪的；证明（或判决）有罪的
She was found guilty of murder in the first degree.  
她被发现犯有一级谋杀罪。
2. showing or having the feeling of having done something wrong  
自知有过失的，内疚的
I feel really guilty about not having written to you for so long.  
我这么长时间没给你写信了，感到十分内疚。

1. the feeling of haveing done something wrong 
内疚
Now he was dead, she felt terrible guilt at the way she had behaved.  
现在他死了，她对自己过去的行为感到深深内疚。
2. the fact of having broken a law  
罪，犯罪
His guilt was not proved and so he went free. 
无法证明他有罪，所以他获释了。

1. risk money on the result of a race, game, match, or a future event  
以（钱、物等）打赌
She bet that I wouldn't pass my exam.  
她打赌说我考试不会及格。
2. be very certain  
确信，敢说
I bet I can run faster than you.  
我敢说我能跑得比你快。

the liquid that is used as fuel for motor vehicles such as cars and airplanes
汽油

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
not be affected by  
不受......影响的，对.....有免疫力的
Most adults are immune to this disease.  
大部分成年人对这疾病有免疫力。

consider (something) to be of worth or to be true; have faith or trust in  
相信......可行，相信......的真实性，信任，信仰
Jim believes in fresh air and exercises for health.
吉姆相信新鲜空气和做操对身体有益。
Do you believe in everything he says?  
你相信他所说的一切吗？
Many native speakers of English believe in Jesus.  
许多母语为英语的人相信上帝。

be able to do  
有......能力做，能做
He had been hardly capable of standing up.  
他几乎不能站起来。

learn about; gain information about  
听说
How did you hear of our goods? Was it through our announcements? 
你是怎么知道我们产品的？是通过我们的广告吗？

in a position further forward than but close to someone or something; in the company of someone  
在.....前面；在......面前
The bus stopped right in front of our house. 
公共汽车就在我们屋子前停了下来。
Please don't talk about it in front of children. 
请别在孩子们面前谈这件事。

when seeing  
一看见
He always faints at the sight of blood.  
他一看见血就会晕倒。
